api

Interface API


  • public interface API
    The interface as an entry point of the data processing layer. This API defines the available operations and its parameters. A class implementing this interface may be a singleton.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        int add(CallbackInterface cb,
      boolean move,
      boolean verbose,
      String repoPath,
      String dataSetPath)
        throws IOException
        Adds a given data set to the specified repository. The data set to be added may or may not be moved (depending on the move flag) and causes a may or may not verbose process (depending on the verbose flag). If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If either repoPath or dataSetPath or both arguments are null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. In case the given data set is already part of the repository, it will be copied / moved again with a different identifier. If repoPath does not point to an already existing repository, a new will be created at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information.This must be a non-null CallbackInterface, otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        move - A flag to specify if the given data set will be moved or not: To get the data set moved, set this to true and false otherwise.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetPath - A relative or absolute path to the repository, the data set will be added to. This path must be in the OS-specify notation if absolute or otherwise relative to the path of the current working directory.
        Returns:
        The unique identifier the given data set has received and will be addressed within the repository.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the dataSetPath cannot be resolved to a valid path, no file or folder could be found or a general exception occurred while copying / moving the data set.

      • add

        int add(CallbackInterface cb,
      String description,
      boolean move,
      boolean verbose,
      String repoPath,
      String dataSetPath)
        throws IOException,
               IllegalArgumentException
        Adds a given data set with a description to the specified repository. There are no ISO control characters like TAB, CR or LF allowed in the description and it is limited to the length of 1000 characters. The data set to be added may or may not be moved (depending on the move flag) and causes a may or may not verbose process (depending on the verbose flag). If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If either repoPath or dataSetPath or both arguments are null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. In case the given data set is already part of the repository, it will be copied / moved again with a different identifier. If repoPath does not point to an already existing repository, a new will be created at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        description - The description of the data set. The length is limited to 1000 characters and any ISO control characters like TAB, CR or LF are not permitted and lead to an exception. If null is used as description a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        move - A flag to specify if the given data set will be moved or not: To get the data set moved, set this to true and false otherwise.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetPath - A relative or absolute path to the repository, the data set will be added to. This path must be in the OS-specify notation if absolute or otherwise relative to the path of the current working directory.
        Returns:
        The unique identifier the given data set has received and will be addressed within the repository.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the dataSetPath cannot be resolved to a valid path, no file or folder could be found or a general exception occurred while copying / moving the data set.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the description parameter contains ISO control characters (like TAB, CR or LF).

      • delete

        int delete(CallbackInterface cb,
         boolean verbose,
         String repoPath,
         AbstractParameteredOption<?>... options)
           throws NoRepositoryException,
                  NullPointerException,
                  IllegalArgumentException
        Deletes data sets matching to all parameter values of the given AbstractParameteredOptions. It returns how many data sets have been deleted. The array of AbstractParameteredOptions must not be null and contain valid subclasses, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. It must contain one or several of the following AbstractParameteredOption: NameOption, TextOption , BeforeOption, BeforeOption. This method deletes all matching data sets, so if no matching sets are found, none will be deleted. This operation may or may not be a verbose process, depending on the corresponding flag. If the repoPath argument does not point to a repository, a NoRepositoryException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        options - A variable list of AbstractParameteredOptions their parameter's values define conditions. Any data set that matches to all of these conditions will be deleted. Must not contain illegal subclasses of AbstractParameteredOption.
        Returns:
        How many data sets have been deleted. It is valid that no data set is deleted. This is likely if no data set matched to all of the given conditions.
        Throws:
        NoRepositoryException - If the repoPath argument does not point to a repository.
        NullPointerException - If the options-array or the cb is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If one of the options-array's fields is of illegal type.

      • delete

        boolean delete(CallbackInterface cb,
             boolean verbose,
             String repoPath,
             int dataSetID)
               throws UnknownIDException,
                      NoRepositoryException
        Deletes the data set with given identifier from the specified repository. Use this method for delete cases where <data set identifier> or option --id has been specified. This operation may or may not be a verbose process, depending on the corresponding flag. If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If repoPath is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetID - The identifier for the data set to be deleted. If no data set with such an identifier exists, a UnknownIDException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        true if the operation successfully completed or false if not.
        Throws:
        UnknownIDException - If no data set with the specified dataSetID exists.
        NoRepositoryException - If the repoPath does not point to a valid repository.

      • export

        Map<Integer,String> export(CallbackInterface cb,
                         boolean verbose,
                         String repoPath,
                         String destFolder,
                         AbstractParameteredOption<?>... options)
                           throws DuplicateException
        Exports the data set with given identifier to the specified destination folder. Use this method for export cases where <data set identifier> or option --id has been specified. If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If repoPath is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. If destPath is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        destFolder - The path to the target repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        options - A variable list of AbstractParameteredOptions their parameter's values define conditions. Any data set that matches to all of these conditions will be deleted. Must not contain illegal sublclasses of AbstractParameteredOption.
        Returns:
        A map with dataset identifiers and their names that have been exported. It is valid that no data set is exported
        Throws:
        DuplicateException - If at least two data sets have the same name. The error contains the identifiers of all data sets which could not be exported

      • export

        boolean export(CallbackInterface cb,
             boolean verbose,
             String repoPath,
             String destPath,
             int dataSetID)
               throws UnknownIDException,
                      FileAlreadyExistsException,
                      NoRepositoryException
        Exports the data set with given identifier to the specified destination folder. Use this method for export cases where <data set identifier> or option --id has been specified. If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If repoPath is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. If destPath is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        destPath - The path to the target repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetID - The identifier for the data set to be exported. If no data set with such an identifier exists, a UnknownIDException will be thrown.
        Returns:
        true if the operation successfully completed or false if not.
        Throws:
        UnknownIDException - If no data set with the specified dataSetID exists.
        NoRepositoryException - If the repoPath does not point to a valid repository.
        FileAlreadyExistsException - If the destPath argument points to a location where the data set already exists.

      • info

        String info(String commandName)
        Returns version of the software and information about commands and/or parameters. The user is also informed how to get more information for a command
        Parameters:
        commandName - can also be empty
        Returns:
        version followed by a list of all commands if the parameter [command name] is empty. For each command the name and a short description is printed. The user is also informed how to get more information for a command. If the command name is specified a complete synopsis and brief description of the command. If help is also false, the short help information will also be printed.

      • list

        String list(int dataSetID,
          String repoPath)
            throws UnknownIDException,
                   NoRepositoryException
        Returns the meta data of the data set with given identifier. The meta data is a TAB-separated table using the newline character to separate rows and the TAB-character to separate columns.
        • The first row contains always the following header names:
          • ID
          • Name
          • Timestamp
          • Number of Files
          • Size
          • Description
        • The name is the original file/folder name.
        • The table is sorted in accordance to the timestamp.
        • If no description has been specified in the add command an empty string is printed.
        • The number of files also includes directories.
        • The size is the sum of the sizes of all files in bytes.
        • The timestamp is defined by the date and time of adding/replacing the data set. It is shown in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
        • In case of an empty or non-existing repository only the header line is printed.

        This method in particular does return a two rowed table: the first row being the headers and the second one being the data row with the values of the data set addressed with the given identifier.

        Parameters:
        dataSetID - The identifier of the data set from which the meta data gets printed. If the given identifier does not point to a data set, a UnknownIDException will be thrown.
        repoPath - The path pointing to a repository. If there is no repository at the given location, a NoRepositoryException.
        Returns:
        meta data as a TAB-separated table. In case of an empty or non-existing repository only the header line is printed.
        Throws:
        UnknownIDException - If the given identifier does not point to a data set.
        NoRepositoryException - If the given repoPath does not point to a repository.

      • list

        String list(String repoPath,
          AbstractParameteredOption<?>... options)
            throws NoRepositoryException
        Returns the meta data of the data set with given identifier. The meta data is a TAB-separated table using the newline character to separate rows and the TAB-character to separate columns.
        • The first row contains always the following header names:
          • ID
          • Name
          • Timestamp
          • Number of Files
          • Size
          • Description
        • The name is the original file/folder name.
        • The table is sorted in accordance to the timestamp.
        • If no description has been specified in the add command an empty string is printed.
        • The number of files also includes directories.
        • The size is the sum of the sizes of all files in bytes.
        • The timestamp is defined by the date and time of adding/replacing the data set. It is shown in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
        • In case of an empty or non-existing repository only the header line is printed.
        • The result will be filtered by the provided options:
          • A NameOption's name leads to a result with data sets only containing the specified name.
          • A TextOption's text leads to a result with data sets where the name or the description contains the specified text snippet.
          • A BeforeOption's timestamp lead to a result with data sets with a timestamp before the specified one.
          • A BeforeOption's timestamp lead to a result with data sets with a timestamp after the specified one.
        • Each option restricts the result. That is, only data sets fulfilling all options are shown.

        This method in particular does return a two rowed table: the first row being the headers and the second one being the data row with the values of the data set addressed with the given identifier.

        Parameters:
        repoPath - The path pointing to a repository. If there is no repository at the given location, a NoRepositoryException.
        options - A vararg list of restricting options of type BeforeOption, BeforeOption, NameOption or TextOption as described in the method description. If that list is empty, a table with meta data of all data sets of the given repository is returned.
        Returns:
        meta data as a TAB-separated table. In case of an empty or non-existing repository only the header line is printed.
        Throws:
        NoRepositoryException - If the given repoPath does not point to a repository.

      • replace

        boolean replace(CallbackInterface cb,
              boolean move,
              boolean verbose,
              String repoPath,
              int dataSetID,
              String dataSetPath)
                throws IOException,
                       NoRepositoryException,
                       UnknownIDException
        Replaces the data set with given identifier completely with the newly specified one. If the old data set had a description, the new data set will receive the same description. The data set to replace the old one may or may not be moved (depending on the move flag) and causes a may or may not verbose process (depending on the verbose flag). If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If either repoPath or dataSetPath or both arguments are null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. In case the given data set is already part of the repository, it will be copied / moved again with a different identifier. This command will behave like a sequence of a delete and add command.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information.This must be a non-null CallbackInterface, otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        move - A flag to specify if the given data set will be moved or not: To get the data set moved, set this to true and false otherwise.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetID - The identifier for the data set to replace. If no data set with such an identifier exists, a UnknownIDException will be thrown.
        dataSetPath - A relative or absolute path to the repository, the data set will be added to. This path must be in the OS-specify notation if absolute or otherwise relative to the path of the current working directory.
        Returns:
        true if the operation successfully completed or false if not.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the dataSetPath cannot be resolved to a valid path, no file or folder could be found or a general exception occurred while copying / moving the data set.
        NoRepositoryException - If the repoPath does not point to a valid repository.
        UnknownIDException - If no data set with the specified dataSetID exists.

      • replace

        boolean replace(CallbackInterface cb,
              String description,
              boolean move,
              boolean verbose,
              String repoPath,
              int dataSetID,
              String dataSetPath)
                throws IOException,
                       IllegalArgumentException,
                       NoRepositoryException,
                       UnknownIDException
        Replaces the data set with given identifier completely with the newly specified one. There are no ISO control characters like TAB, CR or LF allowed in the description and it is limited to the length of 1000 characters. The data set to replace the old one may or may not be moved (depending on the move flag) and causes a may or may not verbose process (depending on the verbose flag). If the verbose flag is set true and the CallbackInterface parameter is set to null an NullPointerException will be thrown. If either repoPath or dataSetPath or both arguments are null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. In case the given data set is already part of the repository, it will be copied / moved again with a different identifier. This command will behave like a sequence of a delete and add command.
        Parameters:
        cb - The CallbackInterface to receive progress information. This must be a non-null CallbackInterface , otherwise an NullPointerException will be thrown.
        description - The description of the data set. The length is limited to 1000 characters and any ISO control characters like TAB, CR or LF are not permitted and lead to an exception. If null is used as description a NullPointerException will be thrown.
        move - A flag to specify if the given data set will be moved or not: To get the data set moved, set this to true and false otherwise.
        verbose - A flag to specify if progress information gets printed or not: To get the progress infos set this to true and false otherwise.
        repoPath - The path to the repository. This path may be absolute (and thus in OS-dependent notation) or relative to the current working directory (CWD). In case the CWD points to the root of a repo, this parameter may be a dot ('.').
        dataSetID - The identifier for the data set to replace. If no data set with such an identifier exists, a UnknownIDException will be thrown.
        dataSetPath - A relative or absolute path to the repository, the data set will be added to. This path must be in the OS-specify notation if absolute or otherwise relative to the path of the current working directory.
        Returns:
        true if the operation successfully completed or false if not.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the dataSetPath cannot be resolved to a valid path, no file or folder could be found or a general exception occurred while copying / moving the data set.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the description parameter contains ISO control characters (like TAB, CR or LF).
        NoRepositoryException - If the repoPath does not point to a valid repository.
        UnknownIDException - If no data set with the specified dataSetID exists.
